reviews.review_msg: Great lectures and course content, with plenty of real world application. Professor is engaging since it is his area of research. Fair grading and he provides worked examples in tutorial.
You can barely hear him in class...

You can get by by not going to lecture, but you can guarantee yourself a good grade by showing up and paying attention. He often let's students know what is important which is a key indicator of what will be on exam. Make sure to do the assignments well ahead of time as they are time consuming. Understanding them will also help you achieve an A.
Worst instructor ever, can't even talk,  how sfu hired him, have no idea.  He's confusion g and hard to hear him in the class.  So boring person and instructor, waste of money &  time

Well prepared and clear lectures.Assignments are challenging, with the deep understanding of materials plus intermediate coding skills, they are do-able.Exams are fair.You will realize how  hard this field is by taking his course, as well as learning a lot.2 advice on Ace this course: 1. Be super clear on important algorithms 2. Do HW yourself.

Jie Liang is open to help his students, and would not turn away his students unless he is really busy.  He's also very hardworking, and often times he's more hardworking than his students.  He can make his lectures more interesting sometimes.

Take this course if you are interested in Matlab. All the course is based on the knowledge of the Matlab. He explains the material of the course clearly. Do not miss the midterm exam otherwise you will be in trouble for your final project.

The material is pretty straight forward. Attendance is highly recommended as Ivan tends to judge/help students depends on their attendance. The marking on the test are extremely subjective, no part marks nor credit given even it is from carry-thru error. He thinks student didn't attend lecture nor study when asking him Q regard lecture/tests.

At first glance, he appears to be a very understanding professor. However, when it comes down to asking him a question in person, he insults you by accusing you of not attending his lectures and belittles you with his arrogance. Find Ivan to be very disrepectful to students and do not answer concerns like most professors.

Very arrogant and won't listen to complains. Hires horrible TAs. Extremely rude to students. Insults those who question his grading scheme. Marks are very subjective and unfair. Useless course in which you learn nothing. Boring lectures that no one attends. He fails both as a professor and as a person. What a shame for ENSC to have him!
